  "description": "Expected to open 2025, Hyatt Regency Lagos Ikeja is ideally located in the serene GRA and just moments away from Murtala Muhammed International Airport. Hyatt Regency Lagos Ikeja is a premier hotel in Lagos, Nigeria, offering the perfect blend of convenience and elegance where our guests feel comfortable, connected, and encouraged to be their best selves because they are welcome and relaxed in our care.

Hyatt Regency hotels and resorts are founded on openness - our colleagues consistently serve with open minds and open hearts to deliver unforgettable celebrations, effortless relaxation and notable culinary experiences alongside expert meetings and technology-enabled collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Revenue Manager

Req ID: LAG000010
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About The Role


	The Revenue Manager will play a crucial role in optimizing the hotel&rsquo;s revenue strategy and maximizing profitability. This position requires a strategic thinker with a strong analytical background, capable of leveraging data to drive decision-making processes. The ideal candidate will work closely with various departments, including Sales, Marketing, and Operations, to ensure alignment with revenue goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Revenue Strategy Development: Develop and implement effective pricing strategies and yield management techniques to maximize revenue across all distribution channels.
	Market Analysis: Conduct comprehensive market research and competitor analysis to identify trends and opportunities for revenue growth.
	Forecasting: Prepare accurate forecasts for occupancy, average daily rate (ADR), and revenue per available room (RevPAR) to guide financial planning.
	Reporting: Generate regular reports on revenue performance, analyzing key metrics and presenting findings to senior management.
	Collaboration: Work closely with the Sales and Marketing teams to create promotional strategies that drive occupancy and enhance the hotel&rsquo;s market presence.
	Inventory Management: Optimize room inventory distribution across all channels, including direct bookings, OTAs, and GDS platforms.
	Training &amp; Development: Mentor and train staff on revenue management best practices and tools


Qualifications


	Previous experience as a Revenue Manager or similar position.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in revenue management within the hotel industry.
	Pre-Opening experience is an advantage.
	Strong analytical skills with proficiency in revenue management software and Microsoft Excel.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
	Knowledge of current market trends and competitive landscape. and social media.
	Preference will be given to local candidates.

  "title": "Project Manager - Integrated & Solutions",
  "description": "Baker Hughes, a GE company (NYSE:BHGE), is the world&#39;s first and only fullstream provider of integrated oilfield products, services and digital solutions. Drawing on a storied heritage of invention, BHGE harnesses the passion and experience of its people to enhance productivity across the oil and gas value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Project Manager - Integrated &amp; Solutions

Job No:&nbsp;R159441
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities
As a Project Manager - Integrated &amp; Solutions, you will be responsible for:


	Leading all elements of the project including Baker Hughes products and services, contracted parties and client interfaces.
	Managing for &ldquo;on time&rsquo; delivery, performance Improvement, and incremental revenue through upsell strategies, additional pull through of additional products or services.
	Owning the overall customer deliverables by having the responsibility for the Integrated Solutions compliance, financial KPI&rsquo;s, service delivery and HSE performance.
	Being responsible for all aspects of the financial performance of the project.
	Leading the support for the sales team&rsquo;s development of any future related opportunity pipelines.
	Aligning cross product line strategies to the Integrated Solutions project deliverables.
	Promoting and driving implementation of Remote Operations in the projects as applicable.
	Managing the core Project Management Team, and indirectly all other project assigned personnel.
	Managing multiple products and services across multiple wellsites/rigs, often in complex contractual arrangements.
	Developing and managing the project schedule at the top level and applies solutions to both leading and lagging situations as well as to unforeseen and predicted events.
	Appling Baker Hughes specific group (Integrated Solutions) Management System processes and procedures to the project, as well as any mandated software solutions that are applicable.
	Utilizing project management methodology in daily working practice, additionally encouraging team members by example.
	Performing as Single Point of Contact (SPC) with the client, nurtures the relationship, acts as the primary contract manager either in conjunction with other contract administrators or with available dedicated contract managers.
	Acting as a strong, committed HSE Leader and provides a full HSE Leadership to all parties involved in the Project through the implementation of Baker Hughes HSE Management system and applicable customer&rsquo;s HSE requirements. Promotes Stop Work Authority &amp; speaking up culture at the project.
	Monitoring Project HSE Performance and leads regular reviews with the involved parties (product lines, contractors etc).
	Participating in internal and external HSE &amp; Quality audits and ensures the identified gaps and improvement opportunities are effectively addressed.
	Ensuring the Project Communication Plan is in place and functional across all levels and areas of the project.
	Creating, modifying, improving Project Execution Plan and all parts thereof, i.e. Risk Management Plan, Communications Plan, Sourcing Plan, Vendor Management Plan, Schedule, Quality Plan, Stakeholder Matrix, Data Management, Readiness Plan, Performance Improvement Plan, HSE Plan and HSE Bridging Documentation.
	Leading continual project reviews, with client, company leadership, internal project staff, contracted parties and potential industry or official bodies. Participates in peer reviews, after action reviews and any investigations as required.
	Guiding proficient networking and touchpoints in a matrix organization to ensure sufficient and effective use of supporting resources for the project from the wider organization.
	Working closely with Integrated Solutions centers of excellence (CoE) in project service delivery and reporting of group KPIs, as well as quality checks of daily operational and financial (Cost/Time) reporting.
	Directs contingency planning from the Emergency Response Plan (ERP) from deployment/testing/&amp; drills, to risk mitigation, particularly, with regard to Well Control and Well Management and reporting per the plan. Acts as a strong promoter of the Management of Change (MOC) process as well as leads the ERT.
	Displaying and encouraging company ethics, initiatives across both the assigned project and the wider organization.
	Plan for contingency operations and ensure organizations are prepared to enact contingencies.


Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:


	Have a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in engineering or scientific discipline from an accredited university or relevant industry experience.
	Have a minimum of 10+ years of experience in relevant industry (wellbore construction, completions, wellbore intervention, P&amp;A etc.) with a minimum of 5 years as a project manager.
	Well Control awareness is required. Well Control Certification would be an advantage
	Experience managing drilling and completions operations and with strong operational and technical capabilities.
	Must be experienced managing change and assessing risk and financial implications of change, inclusive of managing Variation Requests.
	Having a good leadership, excellent interpersonal, influencing and planning skills will be considered necessary for this position.
	Have an excellent English oral and written communications skills, including ability to organize meetings and distributing accurate and succinct minutes of meetings.
	Be experienced needs to include managing multiple product line P&amp;L (Profit and Loss management) and experience managing multiple simultaneous rig/site operations.
	Be skilled in functional use of MS Office Suite, with MS Project familiarity is required.
	Ability to manage, develop, coach and mentor high level teams across organizational boundaries is required.
	PMP (Project Management Professional) certification would be considered an advantage.
	Proven personnel development skills will be required in this role.

Project Manager - Integrated & Solutions Job at Baker Hughes




        
    

        
        Baker Hughes, a GE company (NYSE:BHGE), is the world's first and only fullstream provider of integrated oilfield products, services and digital solutions. Drawing on a storied heritage of invention, BHGE harnesses the passion and experience of its people to enhance productivity across the oil and gas value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager - Integrated & Solutions

Job No: R159441
Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
As a Project Manager - Integrated & Solutions, you will be responsible for:
     

            
    




	Leading all elements of the project including Baker Hughes products and services, contracted parties and client interfaces.
	Managing for “on time’ delivery, performance Improvement, and incremental revenue through upsell strategies, additional pull through of additional products or services.
	Owning the overall customer deliverables by having the responsibility for the Integrated Solutions compliance, financial KPI’s, service delivery and HSE performance.
	Being responsible for all aspects of the financial performance of the project.
	Leading the support for the sales team’s development of any future related opportunity pipelines.
	Aligning cross product line strategies to the Integrated Solutions project deliverables.
	Promoting and driving implementation of Remote Operations in the projects as applicable.
	Managing the core Project Management Team, and indirectly all other project assigned personnel.
	Managing multiple products and services across multiple wellsites/rigs, often in complex contractual arrangements.
	Developing and managing the project schedule at the top level and applies solutions to both leading and lagging situations as well as to unforeseen and predicted events.
	Appling Baker Hughes specific group (Integrated Solutions) Management System processes and procedures to the project, as well as any mandated software solutions that are applicable.
	Utilizing project management methodology in daily working practice, additionally encouraging team members by example.
	Performing as Single Point of Contact (SPC) with the client, nurtures the relationship, acts as the primary contract manager either in conjunction with other contract administrators or with available dedicated contract managers.
	Acting as a strong, committed HSE Leader and provides a full HSE Leadership to all parties involved in the Project through the implementation of Baker Hughes HSE Management system and applicable customer’s HSE requirements. Promotes Stop Work Authority & speaking up culture at the project.
	Monitoring Project HSE Performance and leads regular reviews with the involved parties (product lines, contractors etc).
	Participating in internal and external HSE & Quality audits and ensures the identified gaps and improvement opportunities are effectively addressed.
	Ensuring the Project Communication Plan is in place and functional across all levels and areas of the project.
	Creating, modifying, improving Project Execution Plan and all parts thereof, i.e. Risk Management Plan, Communications Plan, Sourcing Plan, Vendor Management Plan, Schedule, Quality Plan, Stakeholder Matrix, Data Management, Readiness Plan, Performance Improvement Plan, HSE Plan and HSE Bridging Documentation.
	Leading continual project reviews, with client, company leadership, internal project staff, contracted parties and potential industry or official bodies. Participates in peer reviews, after action reviews and any investigations as required.
	Guiding proficient networking and touchpoints in a matrix organization to ensure sufficient and effective use of supporting resources for the project from the wider organization.
	Working closely with Integrated Solutions centers of excellence (CoE) in project service delivery and reporting of group KPIs, as well as quality checks of daily operational and financial (Cost/Time) reporting.
	Directs contingency planning from the Emergency Response Plan (ERP) from deployment/testing/& drills, to risk mitigation, particularly, with regard to Well Control and Well Management and reporting per the plan. Acts as a strong promoter of the Management of Change (MOC) process as well as leads the ERT.
	Displaying and encouraging company ethics, initiatives across both the assigned project and the wider organization.
	Plan for contingency operations and ensure organizations are prepared to enact contingencies.


Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:


	Have a Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or scientific discipline from an accredited university or relevant industry experience.
	Have a minimum of 10+ years of experience in relevant industry (wellbore construction, completions, wellbore intervention, P&A etc.) with a minimum of 5 years as a project manager.
	Well Control awareness is required. Well Control Certification would be an advantage
	Experience managing drilling and completions operations and with strong operational and technical capabilities.
	Must be experienced managing change and assessing risk and financial implications of change, inclusive of managing Variation Requests.
	Having a good leadership, excellent interpersonal, influencing and planning skills will be considered necessary for this position.
	Have an excellent English oral and written communications skills, including ability to organize meetings and distributing accurate and succinct minutes of meetings.
	Be experienced needs to include managing multiple product line P&L (Profit and Loss management) and experience managing multiple simultaneous rig/site operations.
	Be skilled in functional use of MS Office Suite, with MS Project familiarity is required.
	Ability to manage, develop, coach and mentor high level teams across organizational boundaries is required.
	PMP (Project Management Professional) certification would be considered an advantage.
	Proven personnel development skills will be required in this role.

title: Job Openings at Wearing Cloud NG
content:
Wearing Cloud is into the importation of clothes and shoes from China for both kids and adults.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Customer Service / Sales Representative

Job Location: Abule Egba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a friendly and proactive Customer Service / Sales Representative to support customers, manage inquiries, and drive sales across our online and physical platforms.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Respond to customer inquiries via WhatsApp, Instagram, phone, and email
	Assist customers with product selection, orders, and complaints
	Process orders and follow up to ensure customer satisfaction
	Upsell and cross-sell products where appropriate
	Maintain accurate customer and sales records.


Requirements


	Previous experience in customer service or sales (fashion/retail is an advantage)
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Basic computer and social media skills
	Customer-focused and sales-driven attitude.


What We Offer


	Salary: N70,000 / month.
	Competitive salary and sales incentives
	Supportive work environment
	Growth opportunities within the brand


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: fravingsconsulting@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Inventory / Store Manager

Job Location: Agege / Ipaja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Business Owner / Operations Manager

Job Summary


	The Inventory / Store Manager will be responsible for managing all stock-related activities, ensuring accurate inventory records, proper storage of imported clothing, and smooth movement of goods from delivery to sales.
	The role also supports store operations to prevent stock loss and shortages.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and record all imported clothing items and store supplies
	Maintain accurate inventory records (manual or digital)
	Monitor stock levels and report low or excess stock
	Organize and manage the store/warehouse to ensure proper storage and easy access
	Track fast-moving and slow-moving items
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconciliations
	Prevent stock loss, damage, or theft
	Work closely with sales staff to ensure product availability
	Prepare simple inventory reports for management


Requirements


	Previous experience in inventory, storekeeping, or retail management
	Basic knowledge of inventory tracking systems or spreadsheets
	Good organizational and record-keeping skills
	Attention to detail and honesty
	Ability to work independently and take responsibility


Skills & Competencies:


	Inventory management
	Organization and time management
	Basic computer skills (Excel/Google Sheets is an advantage)
	Communication and teamwork.


Salary
N120,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: fravingsconsulting@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Store Attendant / Logistics Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We’re looking for a responsible and reliable *Store Attendant / Logistics Officer* to support routine storekeeping activities.


Role Highlights


	Welcome customers and ensure proper display of products
	Process customer orders with accuracy
	Maintain store cleanliness
	Assist with picking and packing customer orders
	Handle dispatch to motor parks
	Maintain dispatch records
	Support daily store operations


Requirements


	OND / HND holders are preferred
	1+ years in retail or storekeeping is preferred.
	Emotionally Intelligent, proactive, customer service oriented and punctual


Salary
N70,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: fravingsconsulting@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
